content.name: Identity
content.desc: How people identify themselves and their beliefs.

variables.name: Proficiency in English language
variables.desc: How well people whose main language is not English (or in Wales, English or Welsh) speak English
variables.long_desc: How well people whose main language is not English (English or Welsh in Wales) speak English.

categories.name: Main language is English (English or Welsh in Wales)
categories.legend_str_3: English (English or Welsh in Wales) as their main language

categories.name: Main language is not English (English or Welsh in Wales): Can speak English very well or well
categories.legend_str_3: English (English or Welsh in Wales) as their main language, but can speak English very well or well

categories.name: Main language is not English (English or Welsh in Wales): Cannot speak English or cannot speak English well
categories.legend_str_3: English (English or Welsh in Wales) as their main language, and cannot speak English or cannot speak English well

categories.name: Main language is English (English or Welsh in Wales)
categories.legend_str_3: English (or Welsh in Wales) as their main language

categories.name: Main language is not English (English or Welsh in Wales): Can speak English very well
categories.legend_str_3: a different main language, but speak English (or Welsh in Wales) very well

categories.name: Main language is not English (English or Welsh in Wales): Can speak English well
categories.legend_str_3: a different main language, but speak English (or Welsh in Wales) well

categories.name: Main language is not English (English or Welsh in Wales): Cannot speak English well
categories.legend_str_3: a different main language, but cannot speak English (or Welsh in Wales) well

categories.name: Main language is not English (English or Welsh in Wales): Cannot speak English
categories.legend_str_3: a different main language, but cannot speak English (or Welsh in Wales) at all

variables.name: Ethnic group
variables.desc: The ethnic group a person identifies with.
variables.long_desc:
The ethnic group that the person completing the census feels they belong to. This could be based on their culture, family background, identity or physical appearance.

Respondents could choose one out of 19 tick-box response categories, including write-in response options.

categories.name: Asian, Asian British or Asian Welsh
categories.legend_str_3: Asian, Asian British or Asian Welsh

categories.name: Black, Black British, Black Welsh, Caribbean or African
categories.legend_str_3: Black, Black British, Black Welsh, Caribbean or African

categories.name: Mixed or Multiple ethnic groups
categories.legend_str_3: from mixed or multiple ethnic groups

variables.name: Household language (English and Welsh)
variables.desc: People who have English in England, or in Wales English or Welsh, as their main language.
variables.long_desc: Classifies households by the combination of adults and children (aged 3 to 15 years) within a household that have English (English or Welsh in Wales) as their main language.

categories.name: All adults in household have English in England, or English or Welsh in Wales as a main language
categories.legend_str_3: English in England, or English or Welsh in Wales, as the main language for all adults

categories.name: At least one but not all adults in household have English in England, or English or Welsh in Wales as a main language
categories.legend_str_3: English in England, or English or Welsh in Wales, as the main language for some but not all adults

categories.name: No adults in household, but at least one person aged 3 to 15 years, has English in England or English or Welsh in Wales as a main language
categories.legend_str_3: English in England, or English or Welsh in Wales, as the main language for no adults but some children (aged 3-15 years)

categories.name: No people in household have English in England, or English or Welsh in Wales as a main language
categories.legend_str_3: no members that have English in England, or English or Welsh in Wales, as their main language.

variables.name: Multiple ethnic groups in household
variables.long_desc:
Classifies households by whether members identify as having the same or different ethnic groups. 

If multiple ethnic groups are present, this identifies whether they differ between generations or partnerships within the household.

classifications.desc: Multiple ethnic groups in household (6 categories)

categories.name: One-person household
All household members have the same ethnic group
categories.legend_str_3: members that are all from the same ethnic group

categories.name: Ethnic groups differ between generations but not within partnerships
categories.legend_str_3: members from ethnic groups that differ between generations but not within partnerships

categories.name: Ethnic groups differ within partnerships
categories.legend_str_3: members from ethnic groups that differ within partnerships

categories.name: Any other combination of multiple ethnic identities
categories.legend_str_3: members with any other combination of ethnic identities

variables.name: Multiple main languages in household
variables.desc: Whether there are multiple languages in a household.
variables.long_desc: Classifies households by whether members speak the same or different main language. If multiple main languages are spoken, this identifies whether they differ between generations or partnerships within the household.

classifications.desc: Multiple main languages in household (3 categories)

categories.name: All household members have the same main language
categories.legend_str_3: members that all have the same main language

categories.name: Household members have different main languages
categories.legend_str_3: members that have different main languages

classifications.desc: Multiple main languages in household (6 categories)

categories.name: One-person household
All household members have the same main language
categories.legend_str_3: members that all have the same main language

categories.name: Main language differs between generations, but not within partnerships
categories.legend_str_3: members that have different main languages between generations, but not within partnerships

categories.name: Main language differs within partnerships
categories.legend_str_3: members that have different main languages within partnerships

categories.name: Any other combination of multiple main languages
categories.legend_str_3: members with any other combination of multiple main languages

variables.name: Multiple religions in household
variables.desc: Whether there are multiple religions in a household.
variables.long_desc:
Classifies households by whether members identify with the same religion, no religion, did not answer the question, or a combination of these options.

This question was voluntary and the variable includes those who answered the question alongside those who chose not to.

categories.name: One-person household
Multi-person household: No people stated their religion
Multi-person household: Same religion (at least one person has stated a religion but the household may include people who did not state their religion)
Multi-person household: No religion (household may include people who did not state their religion)
Multi-person household: Same religion and no religion (household may include people who did not state their religion)
categories.legend_str_3: a combination of the same religion and no religion

categories.name: Multi-person household: At least two different religions stated (household may include people with no religion and who did not state their religion)

variables.name: National identity
variables.desc: People's national identity (where they feel they belong or could think of as home).
variables.long_desc:
Someone’s national identity is a self-determined assessment of their own identity, it could be the country or countries where they feel they belong or think of as home. It is not dependent on ethnic group or citizenship.

Respondents could select more than one national identity.
variables.caveat_text: There are quality considerations for this variable.

categories.name: One or more UK identity only
categories.legend_str_3: one or more UK identity only

categories.name: UK identity and non-UK identity
categories.legend_str_3: a UK identity and a non-UK identity

categories.name: Non-UK identity only
British only identity
Welsh only identity
Welsh and British only identity
English only identity
English and British only identity
Any other combination of only UK identities
categories.legend_str_3: any other combination of UK identities

UK identity and non-UK identity

Other identity and at least one UK identity
categories.legend_str_3: any other national identity and at least one UK identity

variables.name: National identity (detailed)
variables.desc: People's national identity (where they feel they belong or could think of as home) broken down by country.
variables.long_desc:
Someone’s national identity is a self-determined assessment of their own identity, it could be the country or countries where they feel they belong or think of as home. It is not dependent on ethnic group or citizenship.

Respondents could select more than one national identity.
variables.caveat_text: There are quality considerations for this variable.

variables.name: Religion
variables.desc: The religion people connect or identify with.
variables.long_desc:
The religion people connect or identify with (their religious affiliation), whether or not they practice or have belief in it.

This question was voluntary and includes people who identified with one of 8 tick-box response options, including ‘No religion’, alongside those who chose not to answer this question.
variables.caveat_text: There are quality considerations for the "not answered" category in university locations.

categories.name: No religion
Christian
Buddhist
Hindu
Jewish
Muslim
Sikh
Other religion
Not answered
